entry.title: “We can continue to take an ice pick to an iceberg, or we can...
entry.content:
Abolish ICE Denver

“We can continue to take an ice pick to an iceberg, or we can just bulldoze the whole thing and make it easier for our entire communities to … reach and achieve economic sustainability and security,” said Lorena Garcia. She heads the Statewide Parent Coalition, which works with immigrant and Latino families, and has been instrumental in crafting the legislation."

🚧🚧🚧

"This is what we must do before it’s too late: bulldoze broken systems & replace them with equitable, sustaina...ble, proactive programs & policies that actually address every need and enrich *every* life. This is why we fought so hard to prevent another moderate or fauxgressive from representing our state, and this is why we must keep fighting for radical change at every level of government.

Undocumented immigrants pay taxes, love & fight for their communities, and prop up entire industries... while living in fear and being deprived of livable wages or basic resources anyone would need to thrive. We can change our laws to correct this, so we must."

See MoreSome state lawmakers and immigrant rights activists think this is the year to roll back some of the workforce policies set in 2006, but the plan will face political blowback as critics say it sets a bad precedent.

cpr.org

Colorado’s Undocumented Immigrants Have Been Shut Out Of Benefits And Licensed Jobs For 15 Years. A New Bill Would Change That

Some state lawmakers and immigrant rights activists think this is the year to roll back some of the workforce policies set in 2006, but the plan will face political blowback as critics say it sets a bad precedent.Some state lawmakers and immigrant rights activists think this is the year to roll back some of the workforce policies set in 2006, but the plan will face political blowback as critics say it sets a bad precedent.

entry.title: If you would like to offer support to the camp in Matamoros,...
entry.content:
Abolish ICE Denver

If you would like to offer support to the camp in Matamoros, plug into Border Support Network

"One of the most controversial Trump-era immigration policies — the so-called Remain in Mexico program, officially called the Migrant Protection Protocols — left about 25,000 asylum seekers stranded on the other side of the border while their cases progressed through U.S. courts. President Joe Biden has suspended that program, but immigrant advocates say his administration needs to ...move more quickly to undo the damage. Although dozens of asylum seekers have been allowed to trickle in, many thousands are still waiting in dangerous conditions for their chance to cross the border, including in the Matamoros refugee camp across the border from Brownsville, Texas. It is the largest camp of its kind and holds hundreds of men, women and children seeking asylum, most of them fleeing extreme violence and poverty in Guatemala, El Salvador and Honduras. “We’ve gotten very little government support on the ground with this transition,” says Chloe Rastatter, a field engineer for Solidarity Engineering, a humanitarian organization that provides support in the Matamoros camp. “They say MPP is over, but there’s a camp of 1,000 people still here.”

See MoreOne of the most controversial Trump-era immigration policies — the so-called Remain in Mexico program, officially called the Migrant Protection Protocols — left about 25,000 asylum seekers stranded on the other side of the border while their cases progressed through U.S. courts. President Joe Bi...

democracynow.org

Biden Canceled Trump’s “Remain in Mexico” Policy, But Asylum Seekers Still Waiting in Squalid Camps

One of the most controversial Trump-era immigration policies — the so-called Remain in Mexico program, officially called the Migrant Protection Protocols — left about 25,000 asylum seekers stranded on the other side of the border while their cases progressed through U.S. courts. President Joe Bi...One of the most controversial Trump-era immigration policies — the so-called Remain in Mexico program, officially called the Migrant Protection Protocols — left about 25,000 asylum seekers stranded on the other side of the border while their cases progressed through U.S. courts. President Joe Bi...

entry.title: This week Sanctuary4All Colorado is selling burritos &...
entry.content:
Abolish ICE Denver

This week Sanctuary4All Colorado is selling burritos & champurrado. Ingrid & Gaby are making burritos together to raise money for the emergency fund. It’s a little bit of money that we’re able to tap if anyone is unexpectedly detained or in need of immediate legal representation. The fund provides some peace of mind for everyone, because if something were to happen, there’s money to fall back on. You can support by ordering at https://solidaritymeals.paperform.co.

entry.title: We are asking you to join us in this last effort to save Tien...
entry.content:
Abolish ICE Denver

We are asking you to join us in this last effort to save Tien Pham from being deported to Vietnam. Tien is being held at a staging center used by ICE in Arizona. We hope to get a large number of calls made to the ICE Detention Center in Aurora Colorado from where his case is being managed.

Please also share widely! Here's information for the call:

Call ICE: 720-873-2899 then 1...
Tien Pham

"Hi, my name is ____ and I represent ____ (organization, or city/county where you live). I am calling in strong support of Tien Pham #74515548 who is in transit, while his case continues to be managed from your office. Tien Pham is a refugee from Vietnam.,who spent years in a refugee camp and resettled into San Jose, CA after fleeing his war-torn country. After working hard to be found suitable for parole, Tien was transferred your facility. We’re asking for his deportation order to be reversed and he be allowed to join his family who welcome his return."

See More

entry.title: "The fire last summer still burns against the police,...
entry.content:
Abolish ICE Denver

"The fire last summer still burns against the police, racism, and bigotry. Despite the attempts at co-optation from the Democratic Party and open racism from the Republican Party, youth and workers are still rising up. What lessons can we learn from the uprising last summer to move forward with abolishing the police, breaking with the Democrats, and bringing class struggle together?

Join us for a panel with Black Socialists who were part of the uprisings in 2020 to reflect o...n the movement last summer, the next steps for the struggle, and what it will take to win true liberation.

Panelists:

Tristan Taylor is a leader in the Black-led group Detroit Will Breathe and a member of Left Voice. Tristan led the actions and protests demanding justice for George Floyd and Breonna Taylor. He and dozens of other activists face felony charges for their organizing.

Darrin Johnson is a leader in the group Black Power Collective. Formerly called Black Lives Matter-Inland Empire, the group recently broke with the BLM Global Network. Darrin is a leader in the fight against police brutality in the Inland Empire.

Julia Wallace is a frontline worker and leader in SEIU Drop the Cops, a group aiming to kick the police out of unions. She is also a member and international correspondent of Left Voice.

The purpose of the panel is to engage with fighters in Black, youth, and working-class struggles, reflect on the movement, and, most importantly, how to move forward. International socialist fighters will also be contributing their experiences throughout the discussion."

The event will be on Feb 27th - 3PM PT/6PM ET.

To register to receive the zoom link click here:
https://forms.gle/341AKvjeh77ktyo6A

The event will also be live on facebook.

----

To learn more about Left Voice:
https://www.leftvoice.org/

See More

SAT, FEB 27 AT 6:00 PM EST

Black Socialists on BLM, Class Struggle and Revolution

Online EventCauses · 600 people

entry.title: "The United States provided training to a troubled Mexican...
entry.content:
Abolish ICE Denver

"The United States provided training to a troubled Mexican police unit — several of whose members were charged in a January massacre of 19 people near the US-Mexico border — including after the unit had been flagged for human rights violations by US officials, Mexican civilians and a prominent Mexican politician.

On January 22, authorities discovered the 19 bodies — shot and killed and burned beyond recognition — in a charred pickup truck in the municipality of Camargo, near ...the Texas border. Authorities have identified 16 of the victims through DNA analysis. Of these, 14 were Guatemalan migrants traveling to the United States. The other two were Mexican nationals.

On February 8, the Attorney General’s Office in Tamaulipas announced there was sufficient evidence against 12 members of the Tamaulipas special operations group known as the Grupo de Operaciones Especiales (GOPES) to charge them for the massacre.

The newly-formed GOPES unit was already under scrutiny for human rights abuses in the weeks before the migrant killings. On January 6, a group of at least 25 families in Ciudad Míer accused GOPES officers of having “attacked, robbed and intimidated” their community. As many as four people were allegedly disappeared and tortured by members of the force.

On January 13, Mexican congresswoman Olga Juliana Elizondo urged the Tamaulipas State Attorney General’s Office and the Secretary of Public Security to “investigate and, where appropriate, sanction the human rights violations committed by the GOPES.”

Yet as recently as 2020, GOPES officers received training from US authorities, according to GOPES commander Félix Arturo Rodríguez Rodríguez, who was quoted in multiple news reports. The US agency that provided the training and how it took place remains unclear, but the unit’s officers had a history of training with US law enforcement."

En Español

https://elpais.com/…/la-masacre-de-tamaulipas-el-sueno-amer…

See MoreThe United States provided training to a troubled Mexican police unit -- several of whose members were charged in a January massacre of 19

insightcrime.org

The United States, a Special Operations Unit and a Massacre in Mexico

The United States provided training to a troubled Mexican police unit -- several of whose members were charged in a January massacre of 19The United States provided training to a troubled Mexican police unit -- several of whose members were charged in a January massacre of 19

entry.title: Abolish ICE DenverUnicorn Riot was live.Unicorn Riot is reporting from northern Minnesota where indigenous water protectors and their allies...
entry.content:
Abolish ICE DenverUnicorn Riot was live.

Unicorn Riot is reporting from northern Minnesota where indigenous water protectors and their allies are taking action against construction of the Enbridge Line... 3 tar sands oil pipeline. The controversial pipeline has garnered mass opposition due to the threats it poses both the the global climate and local ecosystems and waterways.

More info on recent resistance against Line 3: https://unicornriot.ninja/…/lockdown-to-keep-it-in-the-gro…/

If you appreciate this coverage, please consider a tax-deductible donation so that we may continue to cover similar stories: https://unicornriot.ninja/donate

Unless otherwise noted, all Unicorn Riot media is published under Creative Commons' NC-BY-SA 3.0 US license
